definition: Tang Emperor Xuanzong (685-762), also known as Emperor Ming of Tang 唐明皇[Tang2 Ming2 huang2], reign name of seventh Tang emperor 李隆基[Li3 Long1 ji1], reigned 712-756
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
Tang dynasty (618-907)/surname Tang
black/mysterious
surname Zong
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs

sentences.english: Ruling the nation by the filial piety was the principle of governance and administration characteristics in power during Tang Xuan' zong.
sentences.chinese: 以孝治天下是唐玄宗的治国原则和施政特点。

sentences.english: Tang Dynasty was at a critical period with tangled contradiction when Li Longji became the emperor .
sentences.chinese: 唐玄宗登上皇位时，正是唐朝矛盾重重的危机时刻。

sentences.english: He once presented litchis from here as a tribute to Emperor Tang Xuanzong's concubine, Yang Guifei.
sentences.chinese: 他曾经把这里的荔枝进贡给唐玄宗的妃子杨贵妃吃。

sentences.english: Concubine Yang was Emperor Xuanzong's favorite concubine in the Tang Dynasty and she was also one of Four Great Beauties in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃是唐玄宗皇帝的爱妃，也是中国四大美人之一。

sentences.english: With the already prepared Qianqiu mirror in their hand, all the state ministers were required of presenting the mirrors to Emperor Xuanzong.
sentences.chinese: 群臣们个个手捧早已准备好的千秋镜敬献给唐玄宗。

sentences.english: Emperor Xuanzong of Tang Dynasty once wrote a poem for this kind of bronze mirror.
sentences.chinese: 唐玄宗曾经为这种铜镜写过一首诗。

sentences.english: Li Lin-fu (8th century) was a prime minister under Emperor Hsuan Tsung of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 李林甫，公元八世纪人，唐玄宗时的一个宰相。

sentences.english: Tang Xuan-zong as a emperor of Tang Dynasty, also write Annotations of Filial Piety.
sentences.chinese: 唐玄宗作为盛世君主，也亲自为《孝经》作注。

definition: Emperor Suzong of Tang (711-762), reign name of eighth Tang emperor Li Heng 李亨[Li3 Heng1], reigned 756-762
Emperor Dezong of Tang (742-805), reign name of tenth Tang emperor Li Kuo 李适[Li3 Kuo4], reigned 779-805
Emperor Gaozong of Tang, reign name of third Tang emperor Li Zhi 李治[Li3 Zhi4] (628-683), reigned 649-683
Emperor Taizong of Tang (727-779), reign name of ninth Tang emperor Li Yu 李豫[Li3 Yu4], reigned 762-779
Emperor Xianzong of Tang (778-820), reign name of twelfth Tang emperor Li Chun 李純|李纯[Li3 Chun2] reigned 805-820

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Emperor Ming of Tang (685-762), also known as Emperor Xuanzong of Tang 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], reigned 712-756
Emperor Zhongzong of Tang, reign name of fourth Tang emperor Li Zhe 李哲[Li3 Zhe2] (656-710), reigned 705-710
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Emperor Xuanzong of Tang (810-859), reign name of seventeenth Tang emperor Li Chen 李忱[Li3 Chen2], reigned 846-859
personal name of seventh Tang emperor Xuanzong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1] (685-762), reigned 712-756
An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
Tang dynasty (618-907)
Emperor Xizong of Tang, reign name of nineteenth Tang Emperor Li Xuan 李儇[Li3 Xuan1] (862-888), reigned 873-888
Emperor Wuzong of Tang (814-846), reign name of sixteenth Tang emperor Li Chan 李瀍[Li3 Chan2], reigned 840-846
